* Build and maintain visualizations and dashboards in Tableau.


**Requirements**
* Capable of developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
* Experienced professional in team-based software development and deployment.
* Skilled in using SQL for data querying and ETL/ELT development.
* Experienced in data warehousing (Redshift) and data modelling.
* In-depth knowledge of AWS services including Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and efficient code.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, data engineering, or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Knowledgeable about various data architectures such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric.
* Experience in data visualization tools.
* Knowledge in or willing to learn infrastructure as code using Terraform.
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow engineers, empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: DevOps Infrastructure Engineer till globalt elektronikbolag!
description:
Tänk dig de mest högteknologiska elektronikprodukterna du kan föreställa dig, och sen tänker du ett steg längre. Med världsledande produktionslösningar leder de elektronikindustrin och skapar dagens mest högteknologiska produkter, men med en ödmjukhet inför att det viktigaste för att lyckas med detta är en passion för såväl affärer som teknik och framförallt människor. Vår kund söker nu deras nästa DevOps Infrastructure Engineer. Sök redan idag då vi går igenom ansökningar löpande!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund ligger i framkant inom mjukvaruutveckling och arbetar med några av de mest avancerade produkterna i branschen. Deras samarbetsinriktade team av erfarna utvecklare har en öppen inställning, där de tillsammans löser utmaningar och tänjer på gränserna för vad som är möjligt. Vår kund främjar innovation och uppmuntrar utveckling samt utforskande av nya vägar för problemlösning.
 


  


 Vi söker nu en skicklig DevOps Infrastructure Engineer som ska fungera som administratör och avancerad användare för vår kunds uppsättning av infrastrukturverktyg, inklusive, men inte begränsat till, Gitlab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, VMware, Cloud Azure och Black Duck. Som expert på dessa verktyg kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att stödja mjukvarans livscykel, från utveckling till driftsättning. Rollen kräver programmeringskunskaper för att arbeta med och underhålla dessa verktyg samt förmågan att utveckla nya verktyg och skript för automation
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du utmanas att höja kvaliteten och bidra med innovativa lösningar.
  
* Att vara en del av ett företag med en mångfaldig kultur och arbetsstyrka. För vår kund är mångfald inte bara en viktig konkurrensfördel utan också själva grunden för en fantastisk arbetsplats och för innovation att blomstra.
  
* Hos vår kund möter du inte bara trevliga kollegor, utan även hög expertis – du kommer att arbeta sida vid sida med några av elektronikindustrins främsta experter, bli inspirerad och inspirera andra när du förvärvar ny kunskap och delar den över funktioner och kulturer.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Administrera och hantera infrastrukturverktyg som Gitlab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, VMware, Cloud Azure och Black Duck.
  
* Stödja mjukvarans livscykel från utveckling till distribution
  
* Utveckla och underhålla skript och verktyg för automation
  
* Arbeta självständigt och ta ägarskap över projekt
  
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa operativ effektivitet
  
* Testa och utvärdera nya verktyg och metoder för effektiv IT-utveckling
  
* Ge stöd för infrastrukturövervakning
  
* Främja automatiserade mjukvarutester och kontinuerlig integration
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad kandidatexamen eller masterexamen i Computer Science eller Software engineer, eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
  
* Har arbetslivserfarenhet av en roll som DevOps Engineer där du fått erfarenhet inom Gitlab, Python, Bash, Debian/Ubuntu Linux, Docker samt Kubernetes.
  
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en agil miljö.
  
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska då båda språken används daligen i organisationen.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Erfarenhet inom Artifactory, Black Duck, VMware vSphere, Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Ansible och/eller Powershell
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  


 Vi söker dig med ett analytiskt tänkesätt och en stark problemlösningsförmåga, som har ett öga för detaljer och är engagerad i att leverera högkvalitativa mjukvarulösningar. Du är anpassningsbar och öppen för att lära dig nya teknologier och verktyg i en ständigt föränderlig bransch. Med god kommunikationsförmåga bidrar du till ett effektivt samarbete med team, utvecklare och intressenter. Dessutom har du även ett genuint intresse för att dela din kunskap och stötta dina kollegor.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Cassandra Martinsson eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv4@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15108269

title: Scania I-talent 2025!
description:
For the ninth time, Scania is launching their very popular I-Talent Program! The I-Talent Program at Scania is an inspiring six-month journey designed for IT graduates with a passion for innovation and sustainability. Participants gain hands-on experience in a specialized IT role, benefit from training, and collaborate with teams in IT, sales, marketing, and R&D. The program not only boosts technical skills but also strengthens soft skills within a supportive network, preparing graduates to contribute to Scania's purpose - to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system. As a participant in the I-Talent Program, you will join IT´s mission at Scania to utilize the power of software and data in all areas: an ideal launchpad for those ready to make a meaningful impact in the tech industry. If you will graduate in the spring of 2025 or have a maximum of 2 years of work experience in your IT career, this program is for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Scania CV Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Södertälje
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September 2025
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Scania is one of Sweden’s largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Their mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing a safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries and together with partners and customers they are driving the transition towards a more sustainable transport industry and are both trend setters and pioneers in electrification and sustainable transport systems.
 


  


 Together with several other I-talents, you will be offered a unique chance to participate in a program that will kick-start your journey at Scania. You are employed in a specific role and belong to a team but alternate the work in your role with meetings together with the other I-talents. The program starts every fall and is designed for you who are new in your career and aim to give you the best possible conditions to grow into your role. I-talent Program consists, in addition to daily work in your team, mainly of three parts – “Learning your professional role”, “Go-and-see” and “Training”. This provides very good opportunities to build a good network within Scania and in addition to your I-talents colleagues and your closest manager, you will be assigned a buddy who will be there for you the first time. At Scania, you are offered a multicultural work environment with ambitious colleagues and a company that invests in leadership. There is room for everyone to grow here, regardless of whether you want to be a generalist, specialist, or a leader. If you have the right attitude and are motivated to take responsibility, you will have all chances to develop!
 


  

  

****Role descriptions****
  

  

  

  

  


  

**OBSERVE!**
 As we are recruiting for several roles at Scania, we want you to select the 2-3 roles that you are most interested in and emphasize this in your CV and cover letter. OBS 2: The advert can be updated with more roles the coming months.
 


  


  

**Data Engineer CAD/PLM Team**



  


 As Data Engineer in Scania’s CAD/PLM team, you will be an essential part of a cross-functional team that develops and adapts the company's CAD/PLM platform. You will join an international and supportive team with great experience in welcoming new I-Talents. Here, you are offered a flexible and tech-focused role where your responsibilities will be adjusted according to current projects and needs. In the role, you will work closely with technology and innovation, with the opportunity to explore AI solutions and their applications in test automation. As part of this team, your work contributes to creating a stable and efficient CAD platform used by Scania's entire R&D department. You will primarily work with programming languages such as Java, C++, and SQL, but for those who are technically curious, there are the opportunities to explore other areas and technologies.
 


  


  

**System Analyst CAD/PLM Team**



  


 As System Analyst in Scania’s CAD/PLM team, you will be an essential part of a cross-functional team that develops and adapts the company's CAD/PLM platform. You will join an international and supportive team with great experience in welcoming new I-Talents. To thrive in this role, a genuine technical interest and the ability to shift between detailed and holistic perspectives are valued. Here, you will work closely with technology, platforms, and business, tackling various technical challenges based on business needs. As a System Analyst, your work contributes to creating a stable CAD platform used across Scania’s/Traton’s R&D. You need to gain an in-depth understanding of how Scania’s CAD/PLM platform functions and see how business requirements can be implemented within the platform. As System Analyst, you will act as the link between developers and business analysts. Depending on your background, the role may also involve development work or a focus on platform usage. Primarily, you will work with Dassault’s CAD/PLM platform 3Dexperience, as well as its integration with Scania’s PDM platform OAS. Programming languages used include JAVA, C++, and SQL; we work on both backend and frontend development and integration tasks.
 


  


  

**Automation/SCADA Developer**



  


 As an Automation Engineer/SCADA Developer, you will be part of a group consisting of around 28 employees, both consultants and employees as well as some former I-talents! The group fulfills an important purpose in supporting the production systems in above all Södertälje, but also in other parts of the world where Scania has their production. The systems ensure, for example, that the operators know how to carry out the assembly and meet time schedules as planned. You will work in a broad role with both PLC programming, testing, configuration and participate in planning meetings for the projects. You will collaborate with for example both production staff, other automation engineers and architects. A suitable background for this role is, for example, an education in robotics and/or automation and preferably with knowledge in Git and SQL. You will be part of a team with a good collaboration where you share knowledge with each other and we are looking for you who take a lot of responsibility, wants to develop yourself and is curious to learn more about this field!
 


  


  

**CAD/CATIA-Platform Development**



  


 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a dedicated truck manufacturer to offering sustainable and complete transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation, and Scania IT has embarked on an exciting journey of change to contribute to this development. Part of this change is to adapt the CAD and PDM section’s systems, and that is what you will be working on! Development is primarily done in C/C++ but, in the long term, also in Java, and we are looking for someone passionate about development and drawn to the challenge of bringing people and technology together to achieve the best results. You will be part of a large department and work in a role with many points of contact; this is a role for someone who thrives in an outgoing work environment where knowledge is shared among colleagues. You don’t need to know everything from the start – what’s most important is your ambition and desire to develop!
 


  


  

**Data Engineer / Data Scientist - Advanced Analytics Team**



  


 As a Data Engineer or Data Scientist in this team, you will be a central part of a cross-functional data science team of 14 people building AI solutions for various parts of Scania. You’ll be welcomed into an international and close-knit team where we value collaboration and curiosity. This role offers you the opportunity to work closely with the business, shaped by ongoing projects and business needs. To thrive with us, we hope you have a strong technical interest and a desire to understand the challenges and opportunities of the business. You will help make Scania data-driven by building models and data pipelines for AI solutions that provide direct business value. You will also have the chance to deepen your skills with tools and technologies such as AWS, Spark, SQL, and Databricks. For this team, we are looking for someone with a relevant master’s level education. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with the business, directly impacting Scania’s results through innovative and value-creating AI applications.
 


  


  

**Developer - Product Development IT**



  


 As part of Product Development IT, you will be positioned between business and IT, working with products used by Scania's internal R&D, which partly consist of third-party solutions. The applications support everything R&D does in Embedded Software development and can include tools for managing development projects, requirement management tools, and procurement tools. All of these are related to various regulations, making these products very important from a safety perspective for Scania. For example, the risk analysis tool is used to analyze truck signals, how it is controlled, and what physical risks might arise to prevent accidents. You will also have a lot of contact with users to understand their needs and desires, and the products are primarily developed in Java, JavaScript, Python, and Velocity. You’ll be part of a social, multicultural team with approximately 10 other colleagues and your immediate manager, some of whom are former I-talents! You will work closely with others on the team, and they often arrange activities such as after-work gatherings, picnics, badminton, and other social activities outside of work. Beyond that, this is a team where everyone supports each other, takes collective responsibility, and shares knowledge. We are looking for someone with a strong interest in developing their programming skills, and if you also have knowledge (or a desire to learn) in DevOps, AWS, Gitlab, or CI/CD, that’s a plus but not a requirement. The most important thing is your willingness and commitment to grow!
 


  


  

**Network Engineer**



  


 As an infrastructure engineer, you will be part of the department that supports Scania’s industrial network across various production units, providing both services and expertise throughout the entire organization. The department includes around 40 employees, with our IUBC group currently consisting of 15 people. Your responsibilities will cover networking, LAN, WLAN, and network security. You will work closely with the business, offering technical expertise, configuring systems, troubleshooting issues, and developing technical solutions. Additionally, you will help maintain corporate standards and policies within this area. In this role, you’ll work with a broad range of technologies within complex IT environments, which is part of what makes the position so exciting. Scania is a large company with numerous users, and we believe this role is ideal for someone eager to gain a comprehensive understanding of how everything fits together from a technical standpoint. We expect you to have an educational background in IT/technology with a focus on networking and security, but the most important qualities are a willingness to learn, an open mind, and a strong sense of responsibility for your own growth!
 


  


  

**Network Engineer Cisco (team 2)**



  


 As a network engineer within Cisco, you will be part of the department that supports Scania's office and industrial networks for their various production units, primarily in Södertälje but also in China, where they are currently building a new factory. The entire department consists of around 40 employees divided into three teams, which you will belong to one of them consisting of 14 people, including your closest manager. Examples of projects your team is currently involved in include building, maintaining, and monitoring Scania’s entire IT network, working with architecture, and ensuring that both Scania and TRATON employees have a network that functions well both technically and in terms of security. Here, you will be part of an engaged team with good collaboration, a wide age range, and a supportive culture where it’s okay to make mistakes—that’s how you learn! You’ll work closely with your team and the other two network groups, as well as with R&D, cloud teams, the security team, and those working with autonomous vehicles, providing them with support on various network-related tasks. A suitable background for this position is an education focused on networks and knowledge in Cisco. You don't need to know everything from the start; the most important thing is your attitude toward self-development and your desire to learn.
   




**We are looking for**

 In this recruitment, we will place great emphasis on your personal qualities and your interest in both the position and Scania as a company. We are looking for committed and talented problem solvers who are happy to come up with new ideas about how things can be improved. You also have great cooperation skills and take responsibility for your own learning. If you do, there are endless opportunities to develop. For example, former I-talents now have both leadership and specialist roles!
 


  

  

****ATTENTION!****
  


 Be clear in your CV and personal letter which 2-3 roles you are mainly interested in and why.
 


  


  

**We are looking for candidates who have:**



  

  
* A post-secondary education in computer science, electronics, mechatronics, network engineering etc.
  
* Knowledge of one or more of the following areas: Java, C#, Kotlin, C++, C, TypeScript, Python, AWS, Spark, SQL, Databrick, network engineering, network security, LAN/WLAN. and PLC programming,
  
* Knowledge of frontend frameworks such as React, Angular or Vue
  
* Graduate in spring 2025 or has up to maximum 2 years of work experience when the program starts in september 2025
  
* Very good knowledge in English as it´s the primary language you will use in your daily work
  


  


  

**Merit**



  

  
* For some of the roles, it will be seen as a merit if you have knowledge in Swedish
  


  

  

****The recruitment process****
  

  
* Phone interview with Academic Work
  
* Tests (problem solving + personality)
  
* In-depth interview with Academic Work
  
* Interview with Scania (for some positions, you will also complete a programming test)
  
* References + decision
  
* Interviews with Scania will take place in Q4 2024 and Q1-Q2 2025.
  


  

  

  

  

  

  

****Other information****
  

  

  

  

  

  
* Start: September 2025
  
* Extent: Full-time, fixed-term employment for 6 months with a good chance of continue your career at Scania after the program
  
* Location: Södertälje and with the possibility of remote work a few days a week
  
* The recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and all questions regarding the process are handled by Academic Work.
  
* Contact details: Responsible recruitment consultants: Emelie Säfbom, emelie.safbom@academicwork.se, Milly Ellqvist Weidstam, milly.weidstam@academicwork.se and Johanna Sörell johanna.sorell@academicwork.se.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Read more about Scania on their website: https://www.scania.com/
   




**Get directly recruited to Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Jenny Rydberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15108450

title: IT Infrastructure Specialist to big bank in Stockholm!
Backend Software Engineer (.Net Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Head of IT Business Solutions Department - based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office, at its headquarters in Luxembourg, the
 **Head of IT Business Solutions Department** 
 .\*
   

  

* internal benchmark: Department Head


 This is a full-time position at grade 8/9.
   

  

*The successful candidate will be offered a definitive duration contract (CDD) of 5 years which may be renewed or converted in accordance with applicable policies and rules.*
*Applicants will receive initial feedback in December 2024.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you ready to be a driving force in a major digital transformation that’s set to redefine how we deliver value in a leading financial institution? As the Head of IT Business Solutions, you’ll have the unique opportunity to shape the future of technology delivery, merging agile innovation with robust software solutions to directly support our strategic goals. This role is about leading a cultural and operational shift toward faster, leaner, and more impactful technology solutions.
   

  

 Join us in a pivotal position where you’ll navigate complex challenges, optimize our software capabilities, and champion an international team in delivering cutting-edge solutions. You’ll have direct impact to shape strategic programs, lead collaborations with diverse stakeholders, and implement impactful changes. This is your chance to make a lasting impact on the bank's digital trajectory, ensuring our technology aligns seamlessly with business needs and drives sustainable efficiency.
   

  

 Are you up for the challenge? Apply to lead transformative change and set new standards in IT excellence!
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Group Chief Digital Officer, within the Group Corporate Services Directorate.
   

  

 The department enables the business and to build fast, efficient and value added business solutions to respond to specific needs for front & corporate applications to client relationship management developments while managing risk & ensuring compliance and is composed of four Divisions.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Strategic leadership including developing and implementing a long-term strategy for IT Business Solutions, aligning with the bank’s overarching strategic goals. Leading critical programs to enhance both business and back-office operations, optimizing our software and systems landscape.
* Drive the organization’s digital ambition by transitioning to modern software practices, including agile, DevSecOps, and cloud solutions. Guide the move towards low-code platforms and the standardization of IT architecture.
* Manage a diverse IT organization, including 100+ internal staff and 400+ consultants, overseeing partnerships and vendors to optimize delivery models, ensure value, and maintain high performance across outsourced and in-house teams.
* Be a strategic partner to key Group stakeholders, influencing and aligning IT initiatives with business needs. Represent IT in senior forums and governing bodies, providing insights and recommendations.
* Ensure continuous alignment with business services and IT Strategy, determine vision and investment decisions, define the organisational structure, transform and optimise delivery practices, assuring the optimal functioning of activities and organisation-wide services
* Contribute to the development enterprise software solutions and coordinate the simplification of our system landscape, selection of any new systems and tools aligned to enterprise architecture standards and business needs, and provide operational services aligned to GDO’s and operational standards (OLAs/SLAs) and relevant policies
* Cultivate a high-performing team through continuous learning and improvement, enabling cross-functional skill-building and capability scaling. Drive a culture of accountability, collaboration, and growth within the department.
* Drive the culture of innovation and empowerment jointly with GDO and business


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in a technology or information management related subject
* At least 10 years of experience related to the IT / information management function
* At least 5 years in a leadership or managerial role demonstrated not only in the operational field but also in terms of motivating large teams and complex projects
* Broad and deep technical, software and technology management, and managerial knowledge of digitalisation practices and IT business applications would be a significant advantage
* Strong software delivery skills and proven track record in scaling up best practices for software development, delivering faster time to value with sustainable cost efficiency
* Proven record of positive transformation programme in a major bank, a public institution or in an international organisation would be an advantage
* Experience in agile ways of working, preferably in scaled model involving business
* Experience in managing outsourced services in IT/data areas would be an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

 Find out more about EIB core and managerial competencies here.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications: 9th December 2024

title: ICT Architect
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson SAN Lab Operations have a strategy to transform the infrastructure service delivery in global standardized ICT environments based on software defined automated services with the aim to enable consumption of services through either a portal or application programming interface (API). This would enable further automation in the consumers’ organizations, mainly the different R&D units within Ericsson.
   

  

 The new person will be a regular team member within the SD&D unit. He/she is expected to be a senior experienced person, with at least 6 years of experience in following areas:
   

  

* Software engineering in a context of automation of infrastructure consumption services
* Network and/or network security operations.


 In addition to the above, any exposure to systems engineering in any part of the Information & Communications Technology (ICT) domain would be a very strong plus.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Active contribution in the design and development of automation of network and network security services, from pre-study to in-production in a corporate data center environment.
* Active contribution to all phases of software development, from the architecture design phase until the automated service in deployed in production.
* Active contribution to the actual software implementation phase, starting with outcome of service architecture design, software architecture design to service being release in production.
* Contribute to the evolution of the development ecosystem (development environment, development support tools…).
* Active contribution to the long-term sustainability of the automation software, end-to-end architectural software consistency and integration assignments, together with other experienced architects.
* Familiar to requirement-based approach to software and service development.
* Apply requirements engineering’s best practices during system design and aligning to Ericsson’s requirements engineering processes.


**The skills you bring:**
* Experience in creating architectures for REST CRUD applications.
* Experience in creating large scale deployment applications.
* Very good abilities with Python programming language
* Other programming & scripting languages (ex.: Perl, Ansible, TypeScript, Jenkins, PHP, MySQL...) are plusses.
* Experience with design of CI/CD setups and related tools.
* Experience designing testing & verifications setups, as well as related tools.
* Experience with containerized service deployment.
* Experience in lean and agile ways of working and its implementation in large organizations.
* Experience with DevOps.
* Experience in network services and/or operations is a major plus.
* Excellent competence in secure architectural system and service design.
* Strong understanding of development practices (Python; REST API's and JSON; Perl; Ansible, YAML, GIT/Gerrit…).
* Understanding of Ericsson's global network infrastructure is a plus.
* Structured and see documentation as a natural way of working.
* Proven track record of achieving results in challenging environment.
* Experience interacting with stakeholders in an international environment.
* Proven track record of being a team player, interacting with strong and highly qualified colleagues.
* See the strength in diversity and gender equality.


 Location - Stockholm OR Linköping
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Linköping
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 754221
   

  

 ]]>

title: Test Engineer - Financial Services
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du vass på test, har ett gediget intresse för teknik och vill få möjligheten att förändra och förbättra samhället vi lever i? Nu söker vi en Test Engineer med bank- och/eller försäkringsbakgrund till enheten Financial Services i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som Test Engineer hos oss på CGI får du möjlighet att vara med och förändra på riktigt. Du får skapa lösningar tillsammans med våra kunder, som bidrar till att skapa hållbara resultat för det samhälle vi lever i. Det kan handla om att skapa effektiva och innovativa lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att leverera bättre service, öka sin säkerhet eller effektivisera sin verksamhet.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en spännande roll med nära kundsamarbeten, stor insikt i affären, stort kontaktnät, varierande och utvecklande arbetsuppgifter. Inom våra åtaganden strävar vi efter en miljö där vi stöttar varandra och har roligt på dagarna. Om du tycker att detta låter spännande så tveka inte att söka.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Att jobba som konsult på CGI innebär en omväxlande vardag. Här erbjuds du möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden. Du kan jobba i små, korta projekt på några månader till stora, långa åtaganden där du kan växa inom samma leverans och påverka dina arbetsuppgifter och roll. Vi deltar i och driver projekt och åtaganden på plats hos våra kunder, men främst från våra lokala kontor eller på distans. Vi arbetar såväl enskilt som tillsammans med andra kollegor i våra projekt. Våra uppdrag genomförs med stöd av etablerade metoder och modeller som baseras på branschstandarder.
   

  

 Som Test Engineer kommer du att ansvara för att tester planeras och genomförs i enlighet med kravställning samt prioriteringar av det agila teamets produktägare. Vi arbetar nära varandra inom teamet, och stöttar givetvis varandra i vårt arbete.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter kan följande ingå:
   

  

* Manuell testning – planera, skriva och genomföra testfall
* Testledning – ta fram teststrategier, testplaner och leda testarbetet
* Automatiserade tester – planera och skapa tester i lämpligt testverktyg
* Front-end test
* Back-end test
* API-testning
* Integrationstestning


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som Test Engineer söker vi dig som tycker om att sätta dig in i komplexa tekniska lösningar, se samband och flöden och utifrån det skapa och utföra testfall som utmanar utvecklarnas lösningar. Den vi söker känner sig också hemma i den finansiella sektorn, bank och/eller försäkring, och har tidigare arbetet med test inom branschen. Det är viktigt att du är en lagspelare då du kommer arbeta tätt ihop med utvecklarna i teamet det även viktigt att du är självgående och har lätt att ta till dig en helhet. Noggrannhet och struktur är andra viktiga egenskaper som värdesätts högt. Du kan även flytande svenska, i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi önskar gärna att du utöver test har erfarenhet från/inom:
   

  

* Agilt arbetssätt
* Continuous Integration
* Systemutveckling (för att kunna skapa automatiserade tester)


 Det är en fördel om du har erfarenhet av följande verktyg som används inom det dagliga arbetet:
   

  

* Gitlab
* Jira inklusive Zephyr
* Azure devops
* Confluence
* Cucumber
* Postman
* Selenium
* Cypress
* Playwright
* UiPath
* Tosca
* Git


 Det är också meriterande om du har testcertifiering såsom ISTQB.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Ansökningar utvärderas löpande, och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas tidigare. Om det fortfarande finns något du undrar över, skicka gärna dina funderingar till Emma De Mont (emma.de.mont@cgi.com)
   

  

 Resor kan ingå i rollen. Personliga säkerhetskrav kommer att krävas om rollen kräver det.
   

  

**Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Senior Fullstack .NET utvecklare
description:
**Vårt kontor ligger centralt i Stockholm med utsikt över kanalen, precis vid Barnhusbron. Här sitter vårt Fullstack .NET team som vi just nu letar erfarna utvecklare till!**
 Fullstack .NET teamet är ett medelstort team på ca 20 personer utspridda på ett antal olika uppdrag. De flesta kör en kombo av hemarbete, arbete hos kund och arbete på vårt Capgemini-kontor. Ett uppskattat inslag när vi hänger tillsammans i teamet är gemensam fredagsfika, regelbundna teammöten och gemensamma aktiviteter. Vår vision är att vara ett team som opererar brett med kompetens att leverera end to end-lösningar till våra kunder.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 I rollen som utvecklare arbetar du i ett agilt utvecklingsteam och tillsammans med erfarna kollegor kommer du att ansvara för komplexa system och lösningar hos våra kunder. Du kommer att ha en viktig och ansvarsfull roll i projekten du jobbar i, därför är det viktigt att du gillar utmaningar, ansvar och att driva saker framåt. Tillsammans med teamet deltar du i alla utvecklingsfaser, från kravanalys till utveckling och leverans. Vidare kommer du som utvecklare även att fokusera på effektivisering, kundnytta och att skapa lönsamma affärer!
   

  

 Tillsammans med dina kollegor hjälper du våra kunder att digitalt transformera och modernisera sina verksamheter. Vårt breda kunderbjudande omfattar allt ifrån rådgivning i tidiga faser till implementation och förvaltning.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
* Minst tre års erfarenhet från utveckling i .NET, C#
* Mycket goda kommunikationskunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Ett stort driv att utvecklas och ta till dig ny teknik
* Har högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom datavetenskap, datateknik, informationsteknik eller likvärdig utbildning
* Fördelaktigt om du har erfarenhet av Azure, DevOps, Dockers, Kuberneters, Microservices


**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS**
* Föräldraförmån
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy
* Tech communities
* Mentorskapsprogram (som mentor eller mentee)
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag & tjänstepension
* Möjlighet till bonusprogram
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar
* Roliga och inspirerande personalevent
* Företagshälsovård & sjukvårdsförsäkring


**ANSÖKAN**
 Vi rekryterar löpande till denna roll, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Från att vi kontaktar dig tar processen cirka 2-3 veckor då vi i största möjliga mån arbetar agilt i rekryteringsprocessen, vilket innebär att flera steg kan ske parallellt.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**OM CAPGEMINI**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda deras övergång till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2023 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,5 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Technical Expert Microsoft Power Platform & SharePoint
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 The
 **Active Directory & Collaboration department** 
 is responsible for providing all services connected to authentication and authorization as well as several collaboration tools, mainly focusing on SharePoint, Power Platform, Teams, Exchange and other Microsoft 365 services.
   

  

 There is now an opportunity for a person to join a positive and successful team with excellent team spirit and highly skilled team members. The position is placed in Stockholm (SE), Berlin (GE) or Katowice (PL).
   

  

 The
 **Microsoft Power Platform & SharePoint Administrator** 
 is responsible for establishing an environment strategy, setting up data loss prevention (DLP) policies, and managing users, capacity, and licensing. They also make data available to makers through connectors, integration, or migration.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities For This Position**
* Operate and troubleshoot the Power Platform environment within Vattenfall Group
+ system health-check and basic maintenance
+ license administration
+ tenant polices administration
+ tenant-based reporting
+ environment management
+ tenant based deployment e.g. applications, connectors

* Design and support improvements and automations of services delivery
* Align and discuss demands from different Business areas
* Cooperation with Microsoft Support as 2nd/3rd level engineer
* Analyze and support with implementation of new featured provided by Ms


**Location :**
 Flexible (Solna, Berlin, Katowice)
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Your profile / who are you?**
 We are looking for someone who is interested in learning, takes initiative and is willing to lead work. Above all, you are curious, committed, self-drive and think it's fun to be involved and make an impact.
   

  

**Next to this you bring:**
* Academic degree as an IT, mathematics, scientific or technical engineer or similar in IT
* Solid knowledge in Microsoft Power Platform administration
* Solid knowledge of Power Platform development (PowerApps, Power Automate)
* Solid programming skills (PowerShell, Graph API)
* Experience of DevOps Pipelines and Azure functions
* Good knowledge of M365 platforms (Teams, Exchange) and Entra ID
* Good knowledge in ITIL and IT security
* A proven ability to communicate with technical experts, customers and group governance
* The ability to build trust and confidence and to be a team player in an international team
* Very good language skills in (technical) English
* Preferable Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Developer or Solution Architect


 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps to build a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of age, religion, gender identity & expression, sexual identity, disability and ethnic background.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Benefits**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English, no later than,
 **December 15th, 2024.** 
 We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

**For more information about the position** 
 you are welcome to contact manager for Collaboration Support (YINAS),
 **Jonas Wanning** 
 , via +46 725 144248. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Recruiter,
 **Lukas Berthold** 
 via lukas.berthold@vattenfall.de.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

 Trade union representatives in Sweden: Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Lars-Erik Näsman (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna) and Lennart Bengtsson (SEKO). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall's switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Senior SAP Specialist
description:
*Do you have a passion for IT solutions, SAP technologies and an interest in top tier organizations? Are you working as a consultant and looking to put your career in overdrive? Are you a high-performing individual who is passionate about IT compliance and risk transformation. Then this is your chance to join our growth journey and to assist our clients in their digitalization processes and help them transform IT risk management and SAP processes!*



**About Us**



As a team, Risk Consulting takes on a wide range of assignments: internal controls assessments, system implementations, IT internal and external audit. We work with the full spectrum of risk advisory services and our people have highly diverse backgrounds including legal, engineering, systems science, accounting and political science. Our diversity in both people and competencies makes us a leading advisor in the marketplace. We work with high-performing clients in all sectors including industrial sector, public sector, and financial services. An important part of our work is digitalization and integrating new technologies to transform risk management and compliance processes for our clients. We advise our clients in their transformation journeys and promote digital, innovative, and sustainable solutions to our clients’ business challenges.


**Your Role**



You will be part of our Nordic Risk Consulting team working as a SME in SAP technologies in different industries and sectors together with competent and inspiring colleagues across KPMG. Our practice is highly diverse and international to mirror our clients and engagements. As a risk consultant within our practice, you will assist our clients in managing and transforming their IT solution and SAP technology and compliance processes to meet ever increasing demands from customers and regulators.


As a risk consultant with a particular focus on SAP, you will be involved in various client engagements within different sectors. More specifically, in your role you will together with other colleagues:


* Drive proposal and business development activities in the Nordics by identifying new target clients, building business relationships with key executives and developing/presenting proposals.
* Plan and execute client engagements focusing on SAP GRC, SAP security, SAP controls and audit readiness of SAP environments; write/present clear and concise reports and presentations containing meaningful observations and recommendations to clients and document procedures performed and conclusions reached related to projects.
* Evaluate the design and effectiveness of SAP controls throughout the business cycle.
* Work with clients to identify opportunities for improvement in the areas of SAP GRC, SAP security and SAP controls.
* Supervise junior colleagues on engagements and help coach and train team members to grow the SAP knowledgebase of the team.
* Apply and maintain a strong foundational knowledge of PCAOB, SOC 1, SOC 2, ISO27001 methodologies and principles.
* Interact professionally with clients and engagement teams and convey gathered information accurately.
* Identify and communicate potential issues and opportunities for audit efficiencies and process improvement to relevant stakeholders.
* Possibility to travel.

  
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**To be successful in this position**, you must have:


* Extensive experience (5+ years) in any of the following areas: SAP IT and automated controls auditing, SAP security design/re-design, SAP GRC implementation, SAP S/4 HANA implementation, Internal Controls in an SAP environment, SAP cybersecurity controls, process mining and data analytics and delivery of managed services around SAP security and controls.
* Hands-on SAP GRC and security implementation or effective SAP audit experience; understanding of SAP tools and capabilities and the related security and control considerations.
* Experience with SAP transformations, governance and risk assessments.
* Knowledge of one or more of the following areas in SAP: AC (Access Control), PC (Process Control), BIS (Business Integrity Screening), RM (Risk Management), SAC (Analytics Cloud), Security/Threat Detection.
* Excellent English language skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication, facilitation, and presentation skills with the ability to gain the confidence and respect of senior level executives.



Furthermore, it is meritorius if you have:


* A university degree in Finance, Economics, Information Security, Data Analytics, Machine learning or a related field.
* Strong network of relationships built from supporting and leading teams that can be leveraged for business development activities.
* Accredited qualification preferred (e.g., CPA, CISA).
* Work permit in Sweden.



We believe that you demonstrate high energy and are eager to take on new challenges. You exhibit strong self-leadership and can manage internal and external client relationships effectively. You are self-motivated and are ready to proactively take ownership over the development of ideas and solutions. Furthermore, you possess excellent organizational skills and can make strong decisions and take initiatives. You work under pressure and maintain commitment to delivering under tight deadlines, and you are diplomatic, pragmatic, and have excellent communication skills.



**Want to make a difference with us?**



Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Susanne Hedberg, susanne.hedberg@kpmg.se


**We look forward to your application and for new colleagues to join our team!**


**-**



In this process we have the following steps;


* Business interviews
* Personality and logical tests with a follow-up in depth interview
* Final discussion
* References
* Background check


**About the company**
---------------------


At KPMG, we know that if we use and act on our insights together with the right people, we find opportunities everywhere. With 2000 employees in Sweden, Latvia and Lithuania, and a network of more than 265 000 experts in 143 countries across the globe, we are one of the world’s leading professional services firms.



We offer expertise within advisory, audit and tax and legal services to many of our region’s leading companies. We may support their organizational change, provide advice regarding risk and compliance, ESG reporting or development journeys, cyber threats, technology transformation, or finance strategy optimization. We also have experts within analysis, M&A and transactions, audit, tax and legal.
company_description: At KPMG, you'll be able to tap into your skills, expertise and passion to help organizations find sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing issues.

title: Advertising Solutions Architect, gTech Ads LCS
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a technical project management or a customer-facing role.
* Experience in building proof of concepts using web/scripting technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.) and SQL databases.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering or Applied Science, or a related field.
* Experience in online advertising technology, online measurement, Google Video and Display products, data integration and cloud technologies.
* Knowledge of key trends and business issues related to digital.
* Ability to understand technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience.
* Excellent relationship building, relationship management, stakeholder management and Influencing skills.
* Excellent problem-solving, analysis, and communication skills.


About the job
  
  

b/b
  
gTech Ads Large Customer Sales (LCS) Tech team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Ads LCS Tech team helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.
  
As an Advertising Solutions Architect (ASA), you will create an excellent experience for Google’s Ads clients by being accountable for gTech service delivery and enabling sales objectives for particular product area. You will serve as a unified service partner who designs and delivers gTech Ads LCS solution and services.
  
Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.To learn more about gTech, check out ourvideo.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Advise Google’s Ads clients by understanding how Video and Display solutions can address their business issues, by acting as a collaborative and inclusive thought partner, architecting solutions and services plans to accomplish their goals, and effectively delivering on, technical, global projects.
* Discover customer needs by understanding clients annual and quarterly issues/goals in collaboration with sales, assessing and prioritizing where gTech Ads can add value and drive uplift, and securing senior client buy-in.
* Participate in ideation and design of a joint services plan by aligning solutions to client focus areas. Unlock new opportunities for growth by scoping projects.
* Deliver services and solutions working closely with other gTech Ads execution teams in region and media solutions.
* Conduct regular debriefs with clients and Sales Teams, gathering insights on clients business objectives.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.
company_description: Our mission is to organize the world’s information and make it universally accessible and useful.

title: Senior Cloud & FinOps Engineer
description:
- **Är du en duktig molningenjör med passion för både tekniska lösningar och kostnadsoptimering? Vill du arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan molntjänster och ekonomi? Då kan Devoteam M Cloud vara platsen för dig!**  

  

Är du redo att rulla upp skjortärmarna och delta i äventyret?
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  

  

**Devoteam** är ett ledande internationellt konsultföretag som arbetar med digitala transformationer. Vi har över 10 000 kollegor i 20 länder.
  

  

Vi på **Devoteam M Cloud** är specialiserade på Microsoft Azure och blev bland annat utsedda till Partner of the Year (Norge) av Microsoft 2023. Vi söker nu fler duktiga kollegor som vill vara med och skapa fantastiska molnresor för våra kunder. Hos oss möter du en miljö som inte bara handlar om teknisk innovation, utan också om att ha roligt på jobbet! Våra medarbetare brinner för att leverera de bästa lösningarna inom Azure, optimering och modernisering.

  
**Ansvar**

* Automatisera molntjänster och kostnadsoptimering: Skapa säkra och skalbara lösningar som ger fullständig insyn i kostnaderna med verktyg som PowerBI och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Spela en nyckelroll i kundens FinOps-resa: Du kommer att hjälpa våra kunder att förstå och förbättra sina molnkostnader, vilket säkerställer att deras investeringar ger maximalt värde
* Arbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team: Tillsammans med kunden, våra tekniker och utvecklare kommer du att leverera holistiska, smarta lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.

  
**Kvalifikationer**

* Praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba med Infrastruktur som kod (IaC)
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet med molntjänster (Azure, AWS og Google Cloud)
* Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att skapa intuitiva PowerBI-instrumentpaneler som ger kunderna full insikt i deras kostnadslandskap.
Du är en problemlösare som arbetar bra med både tekniska och ekonomiska intressenter.  
* 

  

**Personliga egenskaper**

* Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en proaktiv inställning till problemlösning
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta, samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta självständigt
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill ständigt utveckla din kompetens

  
- **Vi erbjuder:**


	* Möjligheten att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö med spännande kunder och projekt
	* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom både teknik och karriär
	* En professionell miljö där kunskapsdelning och kontinuerligt lärande är en del av kulturen
	* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningarHos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens
  

dataplattformar, samtidigt som du arbetar nära innovativa projekt som skapar mätbara
  

resultat. Vi söker en person som är redo för nya utmaningar och som vill utvecklas vidare i en spännande och framtidsorienterad miljö.
  

**Är det här du? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: R&D Program Manager & Agile Release Engineer to Schneider...
description:
**ARE YOU READY TO DRIVE THE FUTURE OF DIGITAL BUILDINGS WITH SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC?**


Schneider Electric is looking for an experienced and driven **R&D Program Manager & Agile Release Engineer (RTE)** to join our Digital Buildings team in Lund, Sweden. This pivotal role will guide the delivery of Schneider’s digital solutions for smart buildings, helping to advance our goals of sustainability, efficiency, and digital transformation. You’ll play a key role in managing programs and leading the Agile Release Train (ART) to drive innovation and elevate our building technology solutions.


As part of our Digital Buildings Line of Business, you’ll collaborate with a diverse team to turn bold ideas into practical solutions that transform building management. This is your chance to shape the future of building technology with Schneider Electric, an industry leader in sustainable innovation.


**Key** **Responsibilities**:


As the **R&D Program Manager &** Agile Release Engineer, you’ll lead the full lifecycle of complex programs to deliver cutting-edge solutions for smart buildings. You’ll oversee program scope, budgets, and timelines to ensure that each project aligns with our strategic objectives. Acting as a bridge across Product, R&D, and engineering teams, you’ll coordinate Agile Release Trains, drive continuous improvement in our workflows, and implement best practices for collaboration, governance, and communication.


In this role, you’ll inspire and coach team members to foster high-performing dynamics and ensure quality in every delivery. With a focus on transparency, you’ll manage key metrics like timelines, budget, quality, and predictability, taking proactive steps to address dependencies and resources for successful project execution. This is a fantastic opportunity to influence the future of building technology while working in a dynamic, supportive environment.


**What** **We’re Looking For:**

To excel in this role, you should bring a solid foundation in program management and Agile methodologies, ideally with experience in software or cloud solutions. We’re looking for a mature, strategic thinker who can navigate complex projects with clarity and precision, inspire trust, and champion a collaborative work environment.


**Essential** **Skills & Experience:**

* Substantial experience in program management or Agile leadership roles.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to foster long-term relationships.
* A background in risk assessment, resource planning, and cross-functional collaboration.
* A Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent practical experience.

**Preferred** **Qualifications:**

* SAFe certification (SPC, LPM, or similar).
* Familiarity with Building Management Systems (BMS) or digital building solutions.
* Proven experience leading multi-site or global product rollouts.

**Why** **Join Schneider Electric?**

By joining Schneider Electric, you’ll become part of a company committed to sustainability, innovation, and inclusivity. We prioritize the growth and well-being of every team member, providing a supportive environment where you can thrive and make a meaningful impact. Here, you’ll work alongside talented and motivated colleagues, enjoy competitive compensation and benefits, and access exciting development opportunities.


Ready to help build the future? Apply now and power your career with Schneider Electric!


**GET IN TOUCH**


This position is based in Lund, Sweden. If you’re excited to learn more, we encourage you to apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. For any inquiries, don't hesitate to get in touch with Cecilia Nork at 070 495 50 90 or send an email to: cecilia.nork@cogig.se

title: SAP S/4HANA Finance, Malmö
description:
***Join our expanding*** ***NORDIC PBS*** ***Team and help leading organizations unlock the value of technology. We specialize in delivering comprehensive SAP solutions that help our clients stay ahead in a rapidly evolving business landscape. Our team is composed of innovative and forward-thinking professionals who are dedicated to achieving excellence.***

**YOUR ROLE**

* **Lead the design, configuration, and implementation of SAP S/4HANA Finance, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.**
* **Provide strategic advice and expertise to clients on SAP S/4HANA Finance solutions, including General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Asset Accounting, Controlling, and Treasury.**
* **Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate SAP S/4HANA Finance with other SAP modules (e.g., SD, MM, PP, WM, PM) and external systems.**
* **Manage and mentor junior consultants, fostering their professional development and ensuring high-quality project delivery.**
* **Stay current with industry trends, the latest developments in SAP S/4HANA Finance, and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.**

**YOUR PROFILE**

* **Minimum 6 years of experience as an SAP S/4HANA Finance Consultant.**
* **Proven track record of successful SAP S/4HANA Finance implementations and optimizations.**
* **Strong understanding of financial processes and the ability to align SAP solutions with business objectives.**
* **Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.**
* **Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients and team members.**
* **SAP certification in SAP S/4HANA Finance is highly desirable.**

**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE:**

* **A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training and a global network of experts.**
* **Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.**
* **A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.**
* **A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.**
* **An innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.**

  

**APPLICATION**  

  

**Does this sound like the right challenge for you? Apply Now and Transform Your Career with Capgemini!**  

  

**We review applications on an ongoing basis and look forward to hearing from you. The recruitment process includes an interview with the hiring manager, a content interview, a logic test, a personality test and reference taking.**

**#LI-LB2**

**ABOUT US**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.**  

  

**With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**  

  

**Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Traineeprogram Infor M3
description:
**Är du nyexaminerad och vill snabbstarta din karriär som affärskonsult?**


* Börja hos oss i augusti 2025 och starta med vårt traineeprogram!


**Första tiden på Meridion är en traineeperiod där de första månaderna fokuserar på utbildning. Interna utbildningar inom vår projektmodell och våra koncept, men även externa utbildningar via våra partners för att lära dig programvaran Infor M3. Stor vikt kommer läggas på din personliga kompetensutveckling.**


**Om oss**


Meridion är ett konsultbolag som arbetar med ett av världens största affärssystem (ERP), Infor M3 och beslutstödssystemet Qlik för att genomföra förändringar hos våra kunder. Vi arbetar primärt åt storbolag inom kategorin tillverkande och distribuerade. Våra kunder finns både i Sverige och utanför dess gränser.


Vi har tre fina kontor, ett i Göteborg vid Stigbergstorget, ett i Anderstorp och ett i Stockholm. Möjlighet till hybridarbete erbjuds.


Meridion grundades 2005 och vi är idag 35 personer med en spännande tillväxtresa framför oss.


För oss är vår laganda och företagskultur otroligt viktigt och ligger oss varmt om hjärtat. Alla medarbetare hos oss blir en viktig del i vårt team för vår fortsatta tillväxt med nya spännande uppdrag, peppiga personalaktiviteter och för att vi tillsammans har en rolig vardag.


**Om tjänsten**


Hos oss kommer du att få lära dig konsultyrket från grunden och få gedigen erfarenhet i hur nya affärsprocesser designas och implementeras. Under din första tid kommer du fokusera på utbildning både internt av våra egna experter där fokus ligger på vår projektmodell, konsultyrket och Meridions strategier, samt externa utbildningar via våra partners för att lära dig programvaran Infor M3.


Därefter gäller praktisk applicering och att komma in i projekt tillsammans med kollegor. Tanken är att få samarbeta med så många som möjligt på kontoret och fokusera på att utvecklas i din nya roll som konsult. Du kommer primärt jobba i projektform i ett team av Meridionkonsulter för att exempelvis implementera M3 Cloud som affärssystem i en fabrik.


Du kommer att jobba tätt tillsammans med våra affärskonsulter där vi uppskattar att du är nytänkande och tänker utanför boxen för att hitta de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder. Våra kunder som vi också hoppas du gladeligen har en tät dialog med om lösningar och önskemål.


Utbildningarna som ges via Infor ger en bred överblick över de olika områdena i M3 för att du ska kunna hitta din nisch:


* Affärskonsult där man kan välja sitt områden inom t.ex. kundorderhantering, produktion, lager eller inköpshantering.
* Finanskonsult, vilket passar dig som har en högskoleutbildning inom finans och vill jobba mer tekniskt.
* Teknisk affärskonsult där man kommer att arbeta med systemintegration eller utveckling/kodning av kundanpassningar och appar. Även här är processutveckling en del av allt vi gör.


**Om dig**


Vi ser att du är nyexaminerad inom industriell ekonomi, logistik, systemvetenskap eller liknande. Du är nyfiken, har en stark inlärningsvilja och är orädd för att testa dig fram.
