Teknik intresserar dig och du är beredd att ta dig an tekniska utmaningar. Stor vikt kommer läggas på dina personliga egenskaper.


**Vad erbjuder vi?**


* Du blir en del i en tight gemenskap där vi växer tillsammans
* **Vi har kul.** Vi trivs med varandra, gör roliga kickoffer, afterworks, tävlar, sportar. Vi gillar när det händer grejer.
* Regelbunden coaching
* Årlig kompetensutveckling
* Friskvårdsbidrag 3000 kr per år. Behöver du koppla av med en massage? Eller ska du göra någon ny sportaktivitet?
* Föräldralön
* Tjänstepension via Avanza, där du blir friare att styra själv
* Sjukvårdsförsäkring


**Vill du bli en i gänget?**


Välkommen med din ansökan genom att maila in ditt CV och personliga brev till jobb@meridion.se eller fyll i formuläret nedan.

title: Data Center Project Manager - Ops Environment/Sustainability
description:
Microsoft’s Cloud Infrastructure and Operations (MCIO) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a Regional PM - Ops Environment/Sustainability, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's over 200 online businesses including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive and the Microsoft Azure platform.  

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 datacenters in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* + Empower a culture of safety, security, and compliance in all aspects of our Datacenter operations.
	+ Represent a regional ESG agenda and directly implement ESG strategy in agreement with the regional lead.
	+ Actively draft and roll out local Sustainability related best practices, procedures and protocols based on the project runbook and in agreement with the program regional lead.
	+ Actively lead the implementation of environmental and energy management systems.
	+ Actively lead implementation of relevant (e.g. agreed regionally) ISO standard programs.
	+ Make forecast, refrecast submissions to fund local sustainability initiatives.
	+ Onboard new vendors.
	+ Manage local vendors, auditors and other suppliers related to execution of ESG projects.
	+ Help organise 3rd party audits.
	+ Attend and actively participate in audits.
	+ Review audits with auditors and provide constructive feedback.
	+ Collaborate with CBRE regarding Zero Waste and sustainability initiatives.
	+ Manage and lead implementation and progression of Zero Waste Program at your location.
	+ Participate actively in local sustainability committees.
	+ Act as an SME in driving sustainability excellence at your location to empower MSFT employees.
	+ Support sites with CoC registration and auditing.
	+ Provide all required reporting in line with reporting cadence.
	+ Provide site specific sustainability training.
	+ Create a local newsletter to share updates and knowledge regarding ESG performance.
	+ Create, own, and utilise a local SharePoint, Database for purposes of collecting data and reporting ESG data.
	+ Critically evaluate data and provide feedback. Be able to identify gaps in data and in methods.
	+ Own and drive employee engagement initiatives to promote sustainability at your sites.
	+ Utilise and be able to sense check data on Power BI and provide critical feedback.
	+ Collaborate with your team peers and cross-functionally to share knowledge and to establish a network.
	+ Escalate issues proactively to regional lead.

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required Qualifications:*** **Desire and possibility to come independently and work from the data center in the** **Malmo** **area at least twice a week**
* **The job requires travel to our data centers in the** **5%-25% travel around Nordic countries to cover future expansion (Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Finland).**
* High School Diploma or equivalent (Bachelor’s degree in Sustainable Energy engineering Sustainable Energy or environmental engineering) AND proven experience of mission-critical service management (e.g., providing IT services, manufacturing, warehouse, retail, military Data Center experience - energy, sustainability, environmental engineering and management), or ESG/sustainability projects in a critical environment.
* Proven experience in project management.

**Background Check Requirements:**Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:  

Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.  

While not required, we also look for the following


**Preferred Qualifications****:**

* Enterprise-level experience managing large scale and complex projects/programs and experience in working with and interpreting ESG regulations, circular economy, sustainability programs, environmental management programs, experience with construction of DC’s and standards (ISO 50001, ISO14001 etc)
* ESG/Energy Sustainability/Energy Engineering associated Masters.
* Experience leading diverse, technical workforce or managing global and virtual teams.
* Applicable certifications: PMP
* Experience working on large scale projects

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

**Ytterligare information** **Vi erbjuder:**

* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningar


Hos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens  

dataplattformar, samtidigt som du arbetar nära innovativa projekt som skapar mätbara

title: CISO Telia Finance
description:
Are you passionate about safeguarding sensitive information in the fast-paced world of finance? Telia Finance is looking for a d edicated and experienced Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to lead our efforts and activities within Cybersecurity , to protect our valuable assets and ou r customers .


Does this sound like you? Apply today and join our team at Telia's HQ in Solna, Stockholm!


**Your next opportunity**

As our CISO, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the security and integrity of our systems, data, and operations. You will also be a key person in the implementation of the DORA regulation that is to come in effect by January with the aims to strengthen the digital security of financial institutions, including credit management companies such as Telia Finance . As CISO in Telia Finance you will work in small and fast paced company with a clear strategy to further utilize our Credit Marketing license . In this role you will be reporting to Head of IT&Security .


**Key responsibilites:**

* Owner of key activities in the DORA implementation project
* Develop , implement, and own steering policies, instructions and guidelines related to IT- securit y.
* Conduct regular risk assessments and security audits to identify vulnerabilities and areas for improvement.
* Oversee the implementation of security technologies and tools to protect against cyber threats and attacks.
* Monitor and analyse security incidents and develop incident response plans to minimize impact.
* Provide guidance and support to teams across the organization on security best practices and compliance requirements.
**Is this you?**

To be successful in this role, we believe you have an IT background and possessing at least three years of documented, relevant experience in a leading role within IT security. You have hands-on experience in cybersecurity and regulatory frameworks such as EBA ICT, NIST Cyber Security Framework, ISO 27001, and Privacy/GDPR. We also believe you have in-depth knowledge of security principles, practices, and technologies, including encryption, firewalls, and intrusion detection/prevention systems, as well as expertise in cloud security.  



Telia Finance is a company regulated by the Financial Supervisory Authority and is subject to specific accounting and regulatory requirements. These roles require at least one year of experience in a credit market company or a similar field.


**We believe you have**

* A broad and solid IT-background , minimum 3 years of documented relevant job experience showing a leading role in IT- security .
* Experience from cybersecurity and reg ulatory frameworks like EBA ICT, NIST Cyber Security Framework, ISO 27001 and and Privacy /GDPR .
* In-depth knowledge of security principles, practices, and technologies, including encryption, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, etc.
* Cloud Security knowledge
* Experience working close to management teams reporting to both executives as well a s in all-staffs
* A dvanced degree or certifications (CISSP, CISM, etc.) preferred.
* Experience from IT security in a regulated environment .
* Profound Swedish and English proficiency , both spoken and written.
**It’s** **more than just a job**

At Telia Finance, we will give you the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. We can offer you your next big opportunity in a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal access to opportunities. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility and offer a wide variety of employee benefits.


Here at Telia Finance we value personal development; for example, we offer Pluralsight to all employees as a way of helping our employees in their personal and professional growth.


**Interested?**

If you are a security professional with a strong drive to make a real and important impact , we want to h ear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications and why you are the ideal candidate for the CISO position at Telia Finance.


If you find this interesting, don’t hesitate to apply for this job. If you have any questions or just want to hear more, feel free to contact our recruiter Christine Wilén, at christine.wilen@teliacompany.com


Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. In the last steps of the recruitment process, required controls will be performed.


We look forward to receiving your application!


**Welcome to Telia Finance – Home to your next big opportunity!**

title: Supervisor Breakfast
description:
**Gothia Towers är en plats för möten och upplevelser för människor från hela världen. Ett fyrstjärnigt hotell med 1200 smakfullt inredda rum och magnifik utsikt över staden samt flera populära restauranger och barer med något för alla smaker. Här finns över 40 000 kvadratmeter upplevelseyta för fest, evenemang, show, konferens och kongress – allt under ett tak. Gothia Towers är en del av Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers.**


 Om rollen


I rollen som Supervisor Breakfast ser vi att du har högt engagemang i det du tar dig an. Du är driven, strukturerad och noggrann. Du ansvarar för en god arbetsmiljö och ser till att rutiner följs, Du älskar att ge service och har ett skarpt öga för detaljer och är extra lyhörd för vad gästen önskar. Du tycker om att arbeta i ett högt tempo, är flexibel och lösningsorienterad. Du har löpande kontakt och samarbete med flera olika avdelningar, främst köket, men även vår säljavdelning, receptionen, staffing disk mfl.


Som supervisor hos oss är förutsättningen att du är bekväm med att leverera en hög service. Du har en arbetsledande roll där du coachar dina kollegor och agerar som bollplank för nya idéer och utveckling. Rollen innebär planering för dagens och veckans kommande dagar samt att tillsammans med teamet genomföra dagens service. Arbetet innebär även administrativt arbete som kräver god datorvana där vi gärna ser att du vill utvecklas löpande inom administrativa delar.


Vem är du?


Du är positiv och engagerad, initiativrik samt ansvarstagande . Du är medveten och bekväm i att din roll är en viktig del i gästens upplevelse. Du presterar alltid ditt bästa och har en förmåga att överträffa gästens förväntningar. Du är en ödmjuk och lyhörd ledare som gillar att motivera och inspirera dina medarbetare. Du vill vara med att skapa ett "värdskap i världsklass". Vi ser att du talar svenska och engelska obehindrat och kan uttrycka dig i väl i både tal och skrift. Tidigare erfarenheter i opera cloud, waitraid är ett plus.


Varför ska du välja oss


Vi är ett stort och sammansvetsat team med positiva och sociala kollegor, som brinner för service.. Med mycket glädje och engagemang arbetar vi med målet att dagligen överträffa våra gästensförväntningar. En spännande tjänst med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter inom ledarskap.


Vi erbjuder 1 vikariat fram till 31 aug 2025 inom kollektivavtalet Visita/Unionen med en sysselsättningsgrad på 100 %. Rekrytering sker löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Sista ansökningsdag är 23 november .


Startdatum enligt överenskommelse. Vid frågor om Tjänsten vänligen kontakta


Petronella Weiholt


031-7508819

 **Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

 *Från hjärtat av Göteborg erbjuder Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers allt från stora mässor och event till oförglömliga hotell- och restaurangupplevelser. Vår verksamhet innefattar många starka varumärken som tillsammans skapar en unik och attraktiv mötesplats där vi varje år välkomnar nästan två miljoner besökare. Som medarbetare hos oss jobbar du tillsammans med ett stort, engagerat och sammansvetsat gäng och är med och utvecklar vår verksamhet, både nu och för framtiden. Inom Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers strävar vi efter en mångfald hos våra medarbetare och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande kultur. Bli en del av vår värld – det är här vi skapar upplevelser för livet.*  

*Läs mer om oss på www.svenskamassan.se och www.gothiatowers.com.*

title: Communication Partner
description:
**Job ID:** R0009705


**Date posted:** 04/11/2024


**Company description**  

Inter IKEA Group brings together three areas: Retail Concept, Range and Supply. Together we work constantly to improve the IKEA home furnishing offer and make it more accessible for the many people. You will be part of IKEA Supply and the Supply Chain Development organisation. IKEA Supply is responsible for securing that the product offer is produced and delivered to our customers. We lead the supply agenda across many functions and work together with all business areas, different business units, but also retail markets to secure customer availability in all markets and sales channels at lowest total cost.


Together, we create a workplace where everyone feels free to be themselves – to experiment, try new ways, and dare to ask, “What if…?” We believe in everyday personal growth and offer the opportunity to develop your career globally. At IKEA we have a vibrant culture where ideas are heard, where there is opportunity to learn new skills and where the goal always is "to create a better everyday life for the many people". We give down-to-earth, straightforward people the possibility to grow, both as individuals and in their professional roles. We offer this position in a fast paced, truly global environment with an endless supply of challenges and development opportunities.


The IKEA culture and values are crucial for our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com or just watch this video: https://bit.ly/ikea-what-if

 **Job description**  

IKEA is on a constant journey to create a better everyday life for the many people by continuously reinvent ourselves as we continue to grow and develop to meet and exceed our customers’ needs. We will transform our digital capabilities, bringing core business processes, people, data & technology together - an enabler for IKEA to become an even better home furnishing company in the future. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us!

**The Role**


We are looking for a technology focused Enterprise Architect for supply chain planning with previous supply chain planning experience. Capable of leading the way in defining a modern supply chain planning architecture for the future. You will be part of the Data & Technology department within the Supply Chain Development organization and have an assignment into the supply chain planning capability area. The Enterprise Architecture function is a key enabler and driver in the ongoing transformation journey of the IKEA supply chain business and operations.

**What you will do**

* Define, lead and own parts of the supply chain planning architecture work. Setting the vision and direction for different digital platforms/products and technology enablers within the supply chain planning area
* With an agile mindset, co-create and build the target state and provide roadmaps and incremental outcome focused transitions needed to reach the wanted position
* Secure architectural guidelines, design principles and lead architectural governance and anchoring through different fora’s and artefacts
* Collaborate and align with stakeholders on different levels across the organization. From senior decision makers to the delivery teams in execution. Drive impact and influence through clear and structured presentations and communication
* Build relationship with external stakeholders like software vendors and drive technology discussions and assessment activities with them
* Besides your “daily” assignments you will get engaged in different opportunities and challenges across the organisation. Acting as a speaking partner and contributor on different topics, spanning from the strategic level to specific solutioning issues


In essence you will design, lead, organise, collaborate and communicate.

 **Qualification**  

This is a senior position, so we believe that you have previous experience working with similar responsibilities in the past and have experience from the supply chain planning domain. It is not a must with an architectural background you could have been working in other technology/digital related roles like leading products, engineering, tech strategy or other tech related functions. Of course, there need to be an interest in architecture and having an architectural mindset in the role. But most important is your personality and your ability to take ownership, building relationships, communicate and manage stakeholders on different levels. Besides supply chain planning platforms and tools there will be a wide range of technology topics to cover. Example topics could be Data & Analytics, Automation, AI & ML, Integrations, API & events, Standardization, Cloud computing and more. We do not expect you to be the expert in all areas, you will have time and opportunity to upskill and learn as we go.

 **More Information**  

If you have any questions about the role, please reach out to the hiring manager Tobias Medin, tobias.medin2@inter.ikea.com


We are mainly open for location in Älmhult (SE) or Pratteln (Basel CH), other IKEA locations like Malmö (SE) could be an option for the right candidate. We do not offer fulltime remote location. Please also note that we only handle applications in English and no applications coming in by email. We look forward to receiving your application at **latest on the 18th of November**  

  

You might have some questions about the recruitment process, and we are more than happy to answer those! Feel free to connect with the People & Culture Leader Dan Gustafsson at dan.gustafsson@inter.ikea.com

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
- We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.


With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.


Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories

  
**Day-to-day life**

* Implement specific GCP-solutions for our clients, build and expand infrastructures, write infrastructure-as-code and execute seamless migrations from on-prem setups
* Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions
* Contribute to pre-sales and help train teammates and solve complex problems
* Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes and Terraform and continue to develop your expertise
* Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions

Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


  
You're passionate about the cloud and love to learn and explore its ever-evolving possibilities. As a senior team member, you're a self-starter who can manage your workload and drive projects forward, while enjoying the collaborative energy of our team. You're client-focused, able to understand their needs, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver presentations that resonate with your audience.
  

  

You're comfortable designing and building GCP architectures, understanding networking, security and containerisation concepts, and working with Infrastructure as Code. You will be able to read and debug code in at least one of the following languages: Python, Golang, Java or HCL. You can manage customer interactions and work effectively with diverse team members. Bonus points if you have experience of migrating from on-premises environments and alternative cloud providers to GCP. Fluency in English is required.


  
- Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?



	* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
	* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
	* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
	* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
	* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn
  

  

**Benefits**


	* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
	* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
	* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
	* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
	* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
	* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
	* A modern office in central Stockholm.
	* Full provision of work tools.
	* A variety of social events.Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.
  

  

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check out our Instagram page .
  

  

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior Cloud Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!
  

  

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

title: Information Technology Service Management Consultant
description:
*Wipro is a leading global information technology, consulting and business process services company. We harness the power of cognitive computing, hyper-automation, robotics, cloud, analytics and emerging technologies to help our clients adapt to the digital world and make them successful. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 270,000 dedicated employees serving clients across six continents. Together, we discover ideas and connect the dots to build a better and a bold new future.* 




  





**Required skills:-** 



* IT Service Management (ITSM)
* Incident Management
* Problem Management
* Service Operations Workspace
* Change & Release Management
* Service Request & Catalogue Management
* Knowledge Management
* Configuration Management & Common Service Data Model (CSDM)Configuration Management Database (CMDB)
* IT Asset Management
* Now intelligence
* Performance Analytics for ITSM
* Virtual Agent (NLU) for ITSM
* Broader experience skills: Experience in large scope implementations familiarity with Agile knowledge of ITIL.



  





**Mandatory Skills:** 



* Servicenow Implementation experience and platform experience.
* Configure the ServiceNow platform during Execute phase of Now Create.



  





**Role & Responsibilities:** 



* ServiceNow Configuration: Perform hands-on configuration and customization of the ServiceNow platform to fit business requirements. ServiceNow Modules in use include Incident Management, Change Management, Service Catalog, CMDB, Asset Management, ITOM and more.
* Scripting
 **:** 
 Write and document clean, efficient, and maintainable code using JavaScript, Web Services, Angular etc. Code reviews and quality control checks should be undertaken as part of every update set/project/upgrade to guarantee maximum efficiency and productivity.
* Technical Acumen: Provide expertise for all technical issues related to development. Oversee the administration of multiple ServiceNow instances including access control, workflow automation, data management, integrations, and system maintenance/upgrade tasks.
* Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with implementation partners, system admins, business users and IT teams to gather requirements, understand process workflows, and translate them into efficient and scalable ServiceNow solutions.
* Solution Design and Development: Design and develop ServiceNow solutions including forms, workflows, scripts, business rules, UI policies, and integrations to meet business requirements and improve overall system performance.
* Testing and Quality Assurance: Manage tool configurations to ensure reliable production. Conduct thorough testing of ServiceNow enhancements, updates, and patches to ensure system stability, functionality, and adherence to best practices.
* Documentation and Training: Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including system configurations, workflows, and customizations. Provide training and guidance to end-users and other administrators on ServiceNow functionality and best practices.
* Continuous Improvement: Maintain ServiceNow certifications, stay updated on the latest ServiceNow features, updates, enhancements, and industry trends. Identify deficiencies or opportunities for process improvement and recommend innovative solutions to optimize the use of the ServiceNow platform.



  





*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, marital status, age, ethnic and national origin, sexual and political orientation and disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

description:

title: Developer Support Engineer for Data Calling
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be responsible for enhancing the developer experience by continuously improving our reference implementations, sample apps, and documentation, while providing top-notch support to our clients' developers. You'll troubleshoot customer integrations of our SDKs and APIs, track FAQs, and identify patterns that highlight potential SDK improvements. Our SDKs use WebRTC technology, making it easy to add real-time, in-app voice and video calling to our clients' websites or apps.
   

  

* Handle and analyse third-line support inquiries to ensure our FAQs remain relevant.
* Help keep our developer documentation up-to-date and user-friendly.
* Build reference implementations and sample apps to simplify the integration of our voice, video, and verification SDKs.
* Collaborate closely with other engineers to stay informed about important updates and new releases.
* Focus on quality assurance and provide first-class support to developers.
* Communicate effectively with clients, ensuring their technical issues are resolved promptly and clearly.
* Conduct QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices to ensure optimal performance and usability.


**Requirements**
* Degree in IT, engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* High proficiency in English, particularly in writing.
* Strong communication skills, with experience in handling customer support.
* Experience in app development or relevant development roles.
* Strong understanding of the development process and effective communication with developers.
* Interest in voice and video calling technologies.


**Good to have**
* Familiarity with Android and iOS application development (Kotlin, Swift).
* Experience of using tools such as Datadog and Kibana for monitoring systems and performing root cause analysis through detailed log and metric exploration.
* Previous experience in a similar support role.
* Experience with voice and video calling.
* Familiarity with WebRTC technology, IP networks or telecom networks.
* Experience in manual and automated QA testing of SDKs on mobile devices.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Management Consultant - IT Advisory
description:

* Management consultant with 4-8 years of experience working in the IT Advisory domain
* Relevant experience from e.g.

* An opportunity to learn the craft of being a project manager where you will be able to leverage previous experience to taking on additional responsibility
* The ability to make a tangible impact both at our clients and internally within Avanti
* Be part of a client and result focused team
* Strong focus on career and competence development with access to a plethora of Internal and external trainings
* A human centric organisation in a meritocracy-oriented environment (eNPS ≈ 50 rolling 12 months)



  





**Who Is Avanti** 




 We are a management consulting firm focusing on the Financial Services sector. This includes life, health and property & casualty insurance as well as retail and commercial banking.
 



 Our services include Strategy & Business Design, Operational Design & Implementation, Service Design, and Digital Enablement. We support our clients throughout the entire project life cycle, i.e., from design to execution. Creating tangible and sustainable results through driving a client transformation end-to-end is the heart of our business.
 



 At Avanti, we believe that execution understanding makes you a better designer of strategy, business, operations, and services. Likewise, by understanding aspects of design, we will become better at driving executions.
 



 We review applications continuously and look forward to your application!

Our services include Strategy & Business Design, Operational Design & Implementation, Service Design, and Digital Enablement. We support our clients throughout the entire project life cycle, i.e., from design to execution.

title: Production Quality Specialist
description:
**Description**


HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a business unit within Hitachi Energy, located in Ludvika. The unit develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. HVDC is also used to connect power grids, e.g., between countries


Are you a person with skills within quality assurance and measurement technology? Then this might be the perfect role for you. As a Production Quality Engineer Specialist, you will be a part of a team that has a passion for continuous improvements and quality assurance. We care and take responsibility in driving the quality to the next level with LEAN Six Sigma principles embedded in our work. The scope of the team is HVDC Valve Assembly in all production units, therefore you will get the opportunity to work together with our other factories in India and China.

**Your responsibilities:**

* Your main responsibility is quality assurance/quality control in HVDC Valve Assembly
* Ensure the implementation of effective internal quality controls during production to verify that processes and products will meet customer and stakeholder requirements
* Be a part in develop and selecting tools for inspections (fixtures, measuring devices)
* Develop and implement quality improvements and Lessons Learned
* Lead Failure Investigation when needed, manage cross-functional teams
* Analyze quality data and drive actions
* Perform MSA and PFMEA
* Be part in implementing new products and production processes

**Your background:**

* You hold a university degree in engineering and/or have some years of work experience within quality assurance in manufacturing. Experience from quality assurance for electronics is a plus.
* Good knowledge in quality assurance, quality standards and measurement technology.
* Background experience within SAP4HANA, MES-Systems, APQP, Lean and experience from using PDCA or similar methodology is preferred.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Good knowledge in Office, non-conformity management tools and statistical software.
* We are looking for an engaged and self-driven person who are true team player with a problem-solving oriented and structured mindset.

**What we offer:**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**Additional Information:**  

Join Hitachi Energy and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy!


Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis so we encourage you to apply today!


Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86 Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85 Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Nicole Bergman, nicole.bergman@hitachienergy.com
company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Electrical Design Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Our unit in Västerås is currently seeking an Electrical Design Engineer to join our Service department. Technical Project Engineering at our company spans a wide range of disciplines, including electrical, mechanical, chemical, civil, structural, automation, and software engineering.


As an Electrical Design Engineer, you will be responsible for electrical design in various projects and support your colleagues with your knowledge. Your tasks will include creating and updating drawings for our installed cabinets, control and protection panels, and the electrical interface to the site.

*“With the right drive and results focus, our organization offers a stimulating* *and dynamic environment on a global scale. Join us at the forefront of the industry, where innovation thrives, and impactful work awaits.” Sofia Normark, Hiring Manager*

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Designing upgrades and updates for sub-systems such as Control, Relay Protection, and Auxiliary Power.
* Fault tracing and proposing corrections in the electrical design of our installed base worldwide.
* Converting technical requirements into validated designs and ensuring customer requirements are met.
* Managing tenders for upgrade and update projects of our installed base.
* Collaborating closely with Design Engineers in Sweden, India, and our local Hitachi Energy units worldwide.
* Upholding Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity, taking responsibility for your actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background:**

* You have a Technical High School diploma, and experience in a similar role within the area of Power Systems. Proficiency is if you also have been working with products or service business.
* It is valuable if you have a University degree in Electrical Engineering and have experience in Electrical Design, Relay Protection Configuration & Testing, Auxiliary Power calculations, commissioning, E3 CAD tool as a user or super user, and/or Model Based Design.
* You need to have an analytical mindset combined with a focus on quality and the ability to propose and design solutions.
* Since you are service minded and hold high quality and on time delivery as equally important, you manage your own planning with diligence.
* As a natural team player, you are communicative, collaborative and always open to new ideas.
* Since you will be part of a global business, you need to be fluent in English, both written and spoken. Swedish is a bonus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? If the description above sounds like you, we welcome your application. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


More information: Recruiting Manager Sofia Normark, sofia.normark@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Nawzad Rashid, +46 107-38 91 48; Unionen: Karin Ulvemark, +46 107-38 51 42 or Ingrid Rinaldo, +46 107-38 58 19; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 48. Talent Partner Filippa Bengtsson, filippa.bengtsson@hitachienergy.com.

title: Enterprise Account Manager - Public Sector
description:
**Humble, Honest, with Heart.**

**The Opportunity**
Nutanix is looking for a **Public Sector Sales Executive,** you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large Government Agencies, Healthcare Regions, Universities and top Government Companies.
You are responsible for selling Nutanix’s Products and Solutions directly to large Public customers and prospects. You will also be working closely with Presales Engineers and the extended account team.**About the Team**
At Nutanix, you will be joining the Swedish team. This team is known for its exceptional performance and in combination with a consistent class-leading employee-NPS score. The team strongly value collaboration across functions and hierarchies, making it a fun, dynamic and rewarding environment to be a part of. As part of your role, you will be expected to travel within Sweden to visit prospective and existing customers. This travel requirement provides you with the opportunity to engage directly with clients and build strong relationships, further enhancing the impact and reach of your work within the region.**Your Role*** As a **Public Sector Sales Executive,** you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large Government Agencies, Healthcare Regions, Universities and top Government Companies.
* You will work in close partnership with an experienced technical Pre-sales engineer
* Forge new and cultivate existing Partner relationships (Resellers, Global Systems Integrators and Alliances) to align go-to-market strategies at the account level.
* Work collaboratively across Nutanix cross-functional teams such as Channel Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, and Product Management to ensure the best possible coverage for your accounts.
* Drive accurate and timely sales forecasting through SFDC
* Develop account plans for Tier 1 Accounts
* Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects by promoting Nutanix’s impact across other Public Sector organisations.
* Recommend Public Sector marketing strategies

**What You Will Bring*** >7 years of outside software sales experience
* A track record of exceeding sales quotas in multiple, continuous years.
* Keen ability to develop new accounts and penetrate new divisions and organizations within your assigned accounts.
* Expertise in selling technology solutions to the Swedish Public Sector, having an existing network of relevant customer stakeholders within this sector which you will utilize.
* An aptitude to articulate how Nutanix technology solves business problems, acting as a trusted advisor to the most demanding public sector organisations in Sweden
* Deep understanding of the competitive landscape and how Nutanix differentiates
* Deep understanding of the customers and partner ecosystem in the region
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills for large audiences
* An entrepreneurial spirit with an affinity for growth, collaboration, and teamwork.
* Highly organized, with deep knowledge of account planning and strategy.
* An expert in Target Account Selling and consultative solution selling
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
company_addresses:
1740 Technology Drive, Suite 150
San Jose, CA 95110 United States
company_description: Nutanix offers a single platform to run all your apps and data across clouds while simplifying operations and freeing companies to focus on business outcomes.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Help us shape the future of mobility**
----------------------------------------

  

  

At Volvo Cars, we’re on an exciting journey to shape the future of mobility. We’re building direct relationships with customers, and aim to be a leader in new technology. It’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. Join us and become a part of our vision for the future – a future that's both exciting and a catalyst for positive change.

  


**About Us**
------------



The Engineering Data Hub drives transformation and implementation of data, analytics & AI within Volvo Cars Engineering. The department handles competence growth and collaborations within data, analytics & AI. The department is cross-functional, consisting of data engineers, data scientists, machine learning engineers and software engineers developing product applications and services with both direct and indirect connection to our cars. By analyzing large amounts of vehicle data, we enhance our products with new and improved functions and services.

  

  

We are now looking for a senior data scientist who can complement our team in extracting data driven insights. We are looking for a person with strong skills in analyzing, modelling and visualizing patterns of large amounts of data, especially time series signals from complex sensor networks.  



**Tasks**

  

  

As a senior data scientist, you will be responsible for turning data into insights using state of the art analytics and machine learning techniques, and to design and train models to improve the analysis of sensor signals from our vehicles and other sources of engineering data. You will work hands-on with spearheading projects aimed to drive innovation and improving our processes for working with vehicle data at Volvo Cars Engineering.

  

  

We believe that you are an innovative problem-solver who can take on a leading role in driving technical development both hands-on and by effective collaboration and knowledge sharing with others.


**Required qualifications**
---------------------------

  

• MSc or PhD in statistics, engineering, computer science, applied mathematics or other  

relevant field, or proven experience achieved by other means.  

* 3+ years industry experience as a data scientist, research engineer or equivalent.
* Strong programming skills and in-depth knowledge of machine learning frameworks (e.g. Python, PyTorch, Tensorflow and scikit-learn).
* Strong visualization, presentation and communication skills.
* Strong experience in data analytics and statistical modelling of large amounts of data.
  

  

**Meritorious:**

  

  

• Experience with machine learning, data mining and algorithms.  

* Experience of advanced time series analysis, anomaly detection and root cause analysis.
* Experience turning conceptual ideas and methods to prototypes and deployments.
* Experience from the automotive industry.
* Experience in Distributed analytics, Edge Learning or Generative AI.
  


**What we offer:**
------------------

  

• Dynamic work environment within a team of computer scientists, mathematicians, statisticians and physicists  

* Full support for continuous personal development at all levels with our own “Volvo Cars School of Data Science” program
* Lots of data to play with and a wide range of application domains

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Gabriela Moraes at gabriela.moraes@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 2nd of December 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Service Upgrade Engineer
description:
**Be part of something altogether life-changing**
-------------------------------------------------


Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.


At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term.


Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

**What you’ll do:**

**Be part of something altogether life-changing**
-------------------------------------------------


Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.


At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term.


Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

**What you’ll do:**


As a result of our growing customer needs to ensure maximum lifecycle utilization of their equipment, we are looking for a *Global Services Upgrade Engineer*. This position will be responsible for managing custom upgrade orders. This includes reviewing order, creating part numbers and a build of materials, sourcing the material, engineering the upgrade, and putting instructions together on how to execute the upgrade in the field.

**What you’ll do:**

* Review customer orders for upgrades and determine whether the upgrade is possible.
* Create a quote and price proposal to customer
* Put together a build of materials for each upgrade and sending a quotation to the requester for the upgrade.
* Manage the upgrade project through installation.
* Maintain appropriate relationships and work with both internal and external suppliers to get pricing and material for each upgrade.
* Assemble and quality check each upgrade before sending to the customer.
* Write any needed documentation for the field team to execute the upgrade at the customer site.
* Handle any customer complaints which come in regarding upgrades delivered.
* Work closely with our manufacturing and align resources needed to deliver upgrades.
* Ensure regular communication to key stakeholders and end users (Service Managers/Field Engineers)
* Develop and maintain quality-controlled processes/SOPs
* Upgrade support to customer and field engineer, travel as needed – 10-15%.

**Who you are:**

* High level of technical knowledge and understanding (hardware/software)
* Bachelor of Science/ Engineering or equivalent
* Experience with electrical and automation design
* Strong focus on customer, quality and meeting customer needs in a global environment
* Excellent communications skills in Swedish and English (oral and written)
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications


Interviews and selection will happen continuously, we look forward to your application today!


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.


At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: Elektroingenjör HW
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Dags för nya kollegor? Vi söker dig med några till flera års erfarenhet som elektronikingenjör inom hårdvaruutveckling.



Som person tycker du utveckling, felsökning och konstruktion av elektronikhårdvara är det bästa att jobba med. Du har djup förståelse för komponenter, PCB-design och Elektronik-cad i något av de ledande systemen.



Vi på Sigma Industry Evolution är ingenjörsföretaget som erbjuder konsulter till både de mindre och större företagen.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Du har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom elektro eller motsvarande.
* 5+ års erfarenhet av att konstruera elektronikhårdvara
* Erfarenhet av Altium
* Viss programmeringsvana

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Som person är du tillmötesgående och gillar teknik. Att ha en förståelse för kundens önskan och teknikens möjligheter är en viktig del i arbetet som teknisk konsult på Sigma.


### **WE OFFER**



Vårt erbjuder en möjlighet att få vara med och bygga upp ett företag i framkant.


* En flexibel arbetsdag
* Högt individuellt förtroende
* En framåtblickande organisation
* Vi drivs av nya idéer och utveckling
* Bra förmåner
* Årliga aktiviteter och konferenser


*Sigma Industry Evolution AB är ett teknikkonsultföretag inom produkt- och produktionsutveckling med fokus på Mekatronik, Elektronik och Embedded Systems.* *Kombinationen av lång branscherfarenhet, stort engagemang, interna och externa uppdrag samt ett tätt samarbete mellan Sigmas olika verksamheter i regionen skapar ett unikt branschöverskridande växthus för ingenjörer. Med mångfald, delaktighet och entreprenörskap stärker och utvecklar vi vår verksamhet och våra medarbetare.*


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Ivan Kertan,  

+46 761287807  

Ivan.Kertan@sigma.se

Elektroingenjör HW
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Evolution

Sweden

Electricity & Automation, Energy & Power Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Opto engineering, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, RF And Microwave, Function development, System design, Project Management, Software development, Digitalisation, Automation

title: software Testing Engineer
description:
software Testing Engineer


Job Description

  


* Knowledge and understanding of different software testing and development methodologies, understanding of software development and testing process
* Test design capabilities
* Experience in Smoke testing, functional, regression and integration testing
* Advanced knowledge of the operating system Windows
* Knowledge in testing desktop applications
* Fluent technical, written and oral communication in English and Russian
* Network configuration knowledge will be an advantage
* Python knowledge and test automation skills will be your advantage
* Engineering background will be an advantage


Main responsibilities:
* Manual testing
* Analysis of test results
* Creation of test cases, checklists, and automated testing scenarios
* Localization and documentation of defects
* Simulation of situations leading to errors, their reproduction
* Monitoring bug fixes
* Preparation and support of test documentation (test plans, checklists, test cases, errors) and testing methods
* Analyse incidents before handing them over to developers

Other:
* This is a long term project.
* Remote work is possible.
* Project starts in early December.

  
Job Overview


* Location : Remote from Europe, Europe
* Vacancy : 1

title: System Verification Engineer for a leading automotive company
description:
Are you passionate about ensuring quality, reliability, and innovation in the automotive industry?
  
  

We are seeking a System Verification Engineer to join a leading automotive company. This is a unique opportunity to work with advanced vehicle systems, ensuring they meet the highest standards of functionality and performance.
  
  

**ABOUT THE ROLE:**  

As a System Verification Engineer, you will be responsible for testing and validating complex automotive systems to ensure they meet design and regulatory requirements. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including software, hardware, and systems engineers, to identify and resolve issues, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance of vehicle systems.
  
  

This role involves hands-on testing in both laboratory and vehicle environments, utilizing advanced tools and methodologies to verify system functionality across a wide range of scenarios. It’s a dynamic position that combines technical expertise with problem-solving in a collaborative setting.
  
  

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**  

A masters degree in electrical engineering, chemical engineering, or a related field.
  
Experience in system testing, verification, or validation within the automotive industry.
  
Knowledge of automotive systems and standards
  
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
  
  

**As a person, you are:**  

Driven
  
Communicative
  
Collaborative
  
Analytical
  
Innovative
  
  

A great emphasis will be placed on personal suitability.
  
  

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**  

**Employment type:** Full-time, long-term
  
**Start date:** As soon as possible or as per agreement
  
**Location:** Göteborg
  
**Contact person:** Gustav Widman, gustav.widman@friday.se
  
**Salary:** Fixed monthly
  
  

Apply by clicking the link below. Be prompt with your application, as we continuously review candidates, and the position may be filled before the application deadline.
  
  

**ABOUT FRIDAY:**  

By partnering with our clients and candidates, we aim to find the best match for both. We achieve this by truly understanding our clients' and candidates' needs. We ensure that requirements and skill sets align, but, most importantly, we focus on harmonizing values and corporate culture, which both candidates and clients find ideal.
  
  

Our passion is to help people find their dream job in the IT & Tech field. This ambition is a significant part of the reason why Friday was founded, with the goal of finding workplaces that give you the "Friday feeling" every day.
  
  

We primarily focus on young engineers who are at the beginning of their careers or soon to graduate from university in the IT and Technology field. We believe that people reach their fullest potential when they look forward to going to work each day. "Friday – every day," how does that sound?

title: Software Engineer - Intern (Remote Internship - IT)
description:
Embark on an exciting journey into software engineering with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and advance your career in software engineering!
   

  

 If you're passionate about software development and have strong problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the mentorship of industry experts, you'll work on diverse software engineering projects, exploring concepts like system design, algorithm development, coding, and debugging. Gain hands-on experience in building robust and scalable software solutions, all from the comfort of your home.
   

  

**Internship Overview and Details:**
* Location: Fully Remote
* Schedule: Part-Time Internship
* Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period


**Requirements**
**Ideal Candidates:**
* Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Aspiring software engineers with a strong interest in software development.
* Analytical thinkers adept at solving complex programming challenges.
* Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team environments.
* Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, technical settings.
* Enthusiastic learners committed to refining their software engineering skills.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, or JavaScript is highly valued.
* Familiarity with software development lifecycle and best practices advantageous.
* Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


**Your Role:**
* Contribute to software engineering projects, writing clean and efficient code.
* Collaborate with the development team to design and implement software solutions.
* Assist in debugging, testing, and optimizing software applications.
* Bring innovative solutions to software development challenges.
* Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in software engineering.
* Support in documenting and presenting software design and solutions.


**Benefits**
**Why Join Us?** 
 Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in software engineering today!
   

  

 Apply now and pave the way for your future in software engineering!
